item.title: Comment on Connect Dynamics NAV table with an External SQL Database by Muhammad Arif
item.dc:creator: Muhammad Arif
item.description: Great work, I have one query i am trying to display message on InsertRecord trigger its work fine when i insert record from nav but when i insert record from SQLServer the message could not display i think when we insert record from SQLServer then its trigger not fired. Any soluction ?
item.content:encoded:
Great work,
I have one query i am trying to display message on InsertRecord trigger its work fine when i insert record from nav but when i insert record from SQLServer the message could not display i think when we insert record from SQLServer then its trigger not fired.
Any soluction ?

item.title: Comment on Connect Dynamics NAV table with an External SQL Database by CNowak
item.dc:creator: CNowak
item.description:
Hi Jaspreet, I want to connect to a transfer database with a given tablestructure. There are fields in then table with datatype „float“. When i do a read on this table i get the error:
Table.Setrange(…); Tabel.FINDFIRST(); -> Error: ... Table content in the IORH_ORDER_HEADER table on SQL Server contains a value that is not compatible with the corresponding data type that is defined for the table.
Field: IORH_WEIGHT Type: Decimal SQL type: float
The table design may have been changed outside Microsoft Dynamics NAV. …
Any idea, how to handle this?
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jaspreet,
I want to connect to a transfer database with a given tablestructure.
There are fields in then table with datatype „float“.
When i do a read on this table i get the error:

Table.Setrange(…);
Tabel.FINDFIRST(); -> Error:
…
Table content in the IORH_ORDER_HEADER table on SQL Server contains a value that is not compatible with the corresponding data type that is defined for the table.

Field: IORH_WEIGHT
Type: Decimal
SQL type: float

The table design may have been changed outside Microsoft Dynamics NAV.
…

Any idea, how to handle this?

item.title: Comment on Post to a rest api in Dynamics NAV by Bart
item.dc:creator: Bart
item.description: Hi, I have a problem running CU 1297 on NAS server. My integration works perfectly fine on the client version (no errors, no dialog windows, nothing), but whenever I run it on NAS it complains about client callbacks for all dotnet variables CU 1297 is using. All of them are already set up not to run on client (as suggested in some forums) but that is not solving the problem. Is it possible to run CU1297 on NAS as all, and if not, is there any alternative to it which would work on NAS?
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
I have a problem running CU 1297 on NAS server. My integration works perfectly fine on the client version (no errors, no dialog windows, nothing), but whenever I run it on NAS it complains about client callbacks for all dotnet variables CU 1297 is using. All of them are already set up not to run on client (as suggested in some forums) but that is not solving the problem. Is it possible to run CU1297 on NAS as all, and if not, is there any alternative to it which would work on NAS?

item.title: Comment on Post to a rest api in Dynamics NAV by Prakash Kumar
item.dc:creator: Prakash Kumar
item.description:
Hi Jaspreet,
These are very excellent articles and it helps alot, but I am stuck at a point where I am trying to call a URL which uses SSO(single sign on) and there it asks for credentials, even though I have supplied the correct credentials to the HttpWebRequest.Credential property still getting issue of 401 un authorized error.
Can you please help in my case.
Regards, Prakash
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jaspreet,

These are very excellent articles and it helps alot, but I am stuck at a point where I am trying to call a URL which uses SSO(single sign on) and there it asks for credentials, even though I have supplied the correct credentials to the HttpWebRequest.Credential property still getting issue of 401 un authorized error.

Can you please help in my case.

Regards,
Prakash
